title: Add vendored release artifacts build to CI
description:
Add build step to create platform-specific tarballs with validation.

## Build Matrix
| Platform | Runner | Output |
|----------|--------|--------|
| darwin-arm64 | macos-latest | gno-darwin-arm64.tar.gz |
| darwin-x64 | macos-13 | gno-darwin-x64.tar.gz |
| linux-x64 | ubuntu-latest | gno-linux-x64.tar.gz |
| linux-arm64 | ubuntu-24.04-arm64 | gno-linux-arm64.tar.gz |

## Canonical Tarball Manifest
```
gno/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                    # Source code
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json            # Version, metadata
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ node_modules/           # All deps vendored
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ @node-llama-cpp/<platform>/bins/*.node
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/ (if exists)     # Runtime assets
```

## Build Steps
```yaml
- name: Install dependencies
  run: bun install --production

- name: Validate native packages
  run: |
    # node-llama-cpp binary
    ls node_modules/@node-llama-cpp/*/bins/*/*.node || exit 1
    echo "‚úì node-llama-cpp binary found"
    
    # Smoke test
    GNO_SKIP_MODEL_DOWNLOAD=1 bun src/index.ts --version || exit 1

- name: Create tarball
  run: |
    mkdir -p dist/gno
    cp -r src package.json node_modules dist/gno/
    [ -d assets ] && cp -r assets dist/gno/
    tar -czf gno-${{ matrix.platform }}.tar.gz -C dist gno

- name: Upload release asset
  uses: actions/upload-release-asset@v1

- name: Verify asset accessible
  run: |
    sleep 5  # Allow GitHub to propagate
    curl -sfI "https://github.com/gmickel/gno/releases/download/$TAG/gno-${{ matrix.platform }}.tar.gz" || exit 1
    echo "‚úì Asset accessible"
```

## SHA256 Calculation (Portable)
Use openssl for consistency across macOS/Linux:
```bash
openssl dgst -sha256 file.tar.gz | awk '{print $2}'
```

## Acceptance
- [ ] All 4 tarballs built and validated
- [ ] Assets verified accessible before formula update
- [ ] Canonical manifest enforced

title: Add absPath to search results with --source flag
description:
## Summary

Search results include `source.relPath` but not absolute paths. GUI integrations need absolute paths for:
- Open in Finder
- Open in editor
- Copy full path

## Current Workaround

Clients must:
1. Fetch all collections via GET /api/collections
2. Build a name‚Üípath map
3. Resolve: `path.resolve(collectionPath, relPath)`

This adds an extra API call and complexity.

## Proposed Solution

Add `absPath` field to search results when `--source` flag is used (CLI) or when requested via API parameter.

### CLI
```bash
gno search --json --source 'query'
# Results include: source: { relPath, absPath, ... }
```

### API
```typescript
POST /api/search
{ query: '...', includeAbsPath: true }
// Results include absPath in source object
```

## Security Note

absPath exposes filesystem structure. Only expose on loopback (already enforced).

## Files to Change

- src/pipeline/types.ts - add absPath to Source type
- src/cli/commands/search.ts - populate absPath when --source
- src/serve/routes/api.ts - populate absPath when requested
- spec/output-schemas/search-result.schema.json - add field

title: Add GitHub Action for auto-formula-update on release
description:
Automate formula updates when new release is published.

## Critical: Release Ordering
Formula update runs LAST, after tarballs verified accessible:
1. Build & test all platforms
2. npm publish
3. Build platform tarballs
4. Create GitHub Release
5. Upload tarballs as assets
6. **Verify assets accessible** (curl -sfI each URL)
7. Calculate SHA256 (from local files or download)
8. Update Homebrew formula (LAST)

## SHA256 Calculation (Portable)
Use openssl for macOS/Linux consistency:
```bash
SHA=$(openssl dgst -sha256 "$FILE" | awk '{print $2}')
```

Or calculate from built artifacts before upload (best - no race).

## Multi-Arch Formula Update Script
```yaml
- name: Update Homebrew formula
  env:
    TAP_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.HOMEBREW_TAP_TOKEN }}
  run: |
    VERSION="${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}"
    
    # Calculate SHA256 from local artifacts (no download race)
    SHA_DARWIN_ARM64=$(openssl dgst -sha256 gno-darwin-arm64.tar.gz | awk '{print $2}')
    SHA_DARWIN_X64=$(openssl dgst -sha256 gno-darwin-x64.tar.gz | awk '{print $2}')
    SHA_LINUX_ARM64=$(openssl dgst -sha256 gno-linux-arm64.tar.gz | awk '{print $2}')
    SHA_LINUX_X64=$(openssl dgst -sha256 gno-linux-x64.tar.gz | awk '{print $2}')
    
    # Clone tap, update formula from template
    git clone https://x-access-token:${TAP_TOKEN}@github.com/gmickel/homebrew-gno.git
    cd homebrew-gno
    
    sed -e "s/VERSION/${VERSION}/g" \
        -e "s/SHA_DARWIN_ARM64/${SHA_DARWIN_ARM64}/g" \
        -e "s/SHA_DARWIN_X64/${SHA_DARWIN_X64}/g" \
        -e "s/SHA_LINUX_ARM64/${SHA_LINUX_ARM64}/g" \
        -e "s/SHA_LINUX_X64/${SHA_LINUX_X64}/g" \
        Formula/gno.rb.template > Formula/gno.rb
    
    git add Formula/gno.rb
    git commit -m "gno ${VERSION}"
    git push
```

## Security: Fine-Grained PAT
- **Type**: Fine-grained (not classic)
- **Repository**: Only gmickel/homebrew-gno
- **Permissions**: Contents (write), Pull requests (write)
- **Expiration**: 90 days
- **Rotation**: Add calendar reminder, rotate before expiry
- **Secret name**: HOMEBREW_TAP_TOKEN

## Acceptance
- [ ] Formula updates run AFTER assets verified
- [ ] SHA256 calculated portably (openssl)
- [ ] All 4 checksums in formula
- [ ] Fine-grained PAT configured
- [ ] Rotation reminder set

title: EPIC 10: MCP server (stdio)
description:
# Implementation Plan

## Overview
Implement MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for gno with stdio transport. Server exposes search, retrieval, and status tools plus resource reads for gno:// URIs.

## Architecture

### File Structure
```
src/mcp/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server.ts           # McpServer setup, transport, lifecycle, mutex
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ context.ts          # ToolContext type + initialization
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tools/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts        # Tool registration + runTool wrapper
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ search.ts       # gno.search (BM25)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ vsearch.ts      # gno.vsearch (vector)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ query.ts        # gno.query (hybrid)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ get.ts          # gno.get (single doc)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ multi-get.ts    # gno.multi_get (batch)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ status.ts       # gno.status (health)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ resources/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts        # gno:// URI handler
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ uri.ts          # URI build/parse/normalize helpers

src/cli/commands/mcp.ts # CLI entry point
```

### Key Decisions
1. **DB lifecycle**: Open once at startup, close on SIGTERM/SIGINT
   - Honor global `--index` and `--config` flags (thread through initStore)
   - Use WAL mode + busy_timeout for concurrent access with CLI
   - Read-only connection preferred if possible
2. **Model lifecycle**: Lazy load on first vsearch/query, keep warm
   - Use ModelManager with states: idle ‚Üí loading ‚Üí ready
   - On failure, revert to idle (allow retry), don't cache broken state
3. **Concurrency**: Sequential tool execution via explicit mutex
   - Single in-process lock around ALL tool handlers
   - Prevents concurrent entry even if SDK invokes concurrently
4. **Errors**: Exception firewall - return isError:true, never throw
   - Wrap every handler in try/catch
   - Convert any thrown error to isError response
   - Never write non-protocol output to stdout
5. **Logging**: stderr only (stdout is JSON-RPC stream)
   - "Protocol mode" for mcp: no stdout except JSON-RPC
   - Disable CLI global error formatting in mcp mode

## Critical Implementation Notes

### Global Flags (--index, --config)
- Thread `indexName` and `configPath` through initStore
- Use `getIndexDbPath(indexName)` for DB path
- Store actual config path used (not getConfigPaths() default)
- status tool must report truthful configPath

### SQLite Concurrency
- Configure `PRAGMA journal_mode=WAL; PRAGMA busy_timeout=5000;`
- Never hold transactions open across awaits
- Every query autocommit

### Input Validation
- Clamp/validate limit (1-100)
- Validate minScore (0-1)
- Validate collection exists (return isError if not)
- Don't trust MCP client input

### URI Normalization
- parseGnoUri() ‚Üí {collection, path}
- Rebuild canonical: buildGnoUri(collection, path)
- Lookup by canonical URI (handles encoded vs unencoded)

### Tool/Resource Naming
- Tool IDs exactly per spec: gno.search, gno.vsearch, gno.query, gno.get, gno.multi_get, gno.status
- Internal naming can vary

### absPath Consistency
- MCP tools MUST include source.absPath in results
- Post-process: relPath + collection root ‚Üí absPath

### DRY Helper
```typescript
// Shared runTool wrapper for response shaping
async function runTool<T>(
  name: string,
  fn: () => Promise<T>,
  formatText: (data: T) => string
): Promise<CallToolResult> {
  try {
    const data = await fn();
    return {
      content: [{ type: 'text', text: formatText(data) }],
      structuredContent: data
    };
  } catch (e) {
    return {
      isError: true,
      content: [{ type: 'text', text: `Error: ${e.message}` }]
    };
  }
}
```

## Reuse Points
- `initStore()` from shared.ts (modify for persistent + index/config threading)
- `searchBm25()`, `searchVectorWithEmbedding()`, `searchHybrid()` from pipeline
- `formatSearchResults()` for content[] text (derive from structuredContent)
- Output schemas from spec/output-schemas/

## References
- spec/mcp.md - Full protocol spec
- spec/output-schemas/*.json - Response schemas
- @modelcontextprotocol/sdk - TypeScript SDK
- src/cli/commands/shared.ts:42-109 - initStore() pattern
- src/pipeline/*.ts - Search functions to wrap

title: EPIC 15: Web UI enhancements (editing, collections, capture)
description:
## Summary

Enhance the Web UI with document editing, collection management, and quick capture. Transforms GNO from search-only to a full note management interface.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Frontend Design Plugin

**ALL UI work in this epic MUST use the frontend-design plugin.**

## Dependencies

- Requires: gno-nbq including:
  - GET /api/docs/:docid (editor endpoint)
  - POST /api/docs/:docid/reindex
  - GET /api/doc adding editable, indexStale, path fields

## Architecture Decisions

### Save vs Reindex (Separated Concerns)
- **Save** = write file to disk only (fast, synchronous)
- **Reindex** = update vectors/search index (async job)
- PUT returns { success, needsReindex: true }

### Stale Detection (Server-Authoritative)
- GET /api/doc returns `indexStale: boolean | null`
- **Type: boolean | null** (formalized tri-state):
  - `true` = file mtime > indexed sourceMtime (stale)
  - `false` = file mtime <= indexed sourceMtime (current)
  - `null` = cannot determine (file missing, symlink escapes, etc.)
- **Comparison rules:** epoch ms, strict greater-than, missing sourceMtime = true
- **UI for null:** "Cannot determine staleness" - disable per-doc reindex button
- **Schema:** Update spec/output-schemas to reflect `boolean | null`

**Dashboard pending count:**
- localStorage tracks UI session edits only
- Display: "Edited in this browser session: N"

### Reindex Scopes
- Per-doc (DocView): POST /api/docs/:docid/reindex
- Collection (Dashboard): POST /api/sync { collection }

### Document Identity
- **docid:** URL-safe hex, stable for indexed entry lifetime
- If renamed+reindexed, old docid 404s
- **All client path construction MUST use encodeURIComponent()**
- **404 UX:** "Document no longer exists" with Back, Search, Browse collection buttons

### Editability (Allowlist)
- **Editable:** md, markdown, txt, text, json, yaml, yml, toml, xml, css
- **Case-insensitive**, missing ext = not editable

### Preview Mode by Extension
- **Markdown preview:** md, markdown (split view)
- **Editor-only:** all other editable types

### MirrorDoc UX
- If `editable: false`: hide Edit, show "Original file: {path}" with copy button
- Path from GET /api/doc (extended)

### Markdown Security
- react-markdown + rehype-sanitize
- Block javascript:, file: protocols
- **Sanitize schema allows `target` + `rel` on `a` tags** (for external links)

### Relative Link Resolution
1. **Anchors (#section):** Scroll within preview
2. **Relative paths:** Navigate to /doc?uri=...
3. **External (//host):** target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"
4. **Absolute (/path):** Block

### Save Ordering
- Client serialization: max 1 in-flight, queue latest
- Max wait 30s while dirty

### Multi-Client (Documented Limitation)
- Concurrent editing not supported, last save wins

## API Contracts

### Field Semantics
- `needsReindex` = returned by PUT (immediate context)
- `indexStale` = read-time comparison (boolean | null)

### PUT /api/docs/:docid

**Atomic Write:**
- POSIX: write temp, rename (atomic)
- **Windows:** backup-rename pattern:
  - Write to `.gno-tmp-{random}` (hidden temp)
  - Rename dest ‚Üí dest.gno-bak
  - Rename temp ‚Üí dest
  - Delete .gno-bak (best-effort)
- **Backup naming:** `.gno-bak` suffix won't match typical patterns (.md, .txt)
- **Cleanup:** On startup, attempt to remove stale `.gno-tmp-*` and `.gno-bak` files
- **Documented limitation:** Not fully atomic on Windows, but safer than unlink-first

**Path Traversal (Missing File Algorithm):**
```typescript
const fullPath = path.resolve(collection.path, relPath);
const rootReal = await realpath(collection.path);

try {
  const targetReal = await realpath(fullPath);
  if (!targetReal.startsWith(rootReal + path.sep)) {
    return errorResponse('PATH_TRAVERSAL', 403);
  }
} catch (e) {
  // File or dir missing - check parent
  const parentPath = path.dirname(fullPath);
  try {
    const parentReal = await realpath(parentPath);
    if (!parentReal.startsWith(rootReal + path.sep)) {
      return errorResponse('PATH_TRAVERSAL', 403);
    }
  } catch {
    // Parent also missing - FILE_NOT_FOUND
  }
  return errorResponse('FILE_NOT_FOUND', 404);
}
```

**Errors:** NOT_FOUND, FILE_NOT_FOUND, NOT_EDITABLE, VALIDATION, PATH_TRAVERSAL, RUNTIME

### GET /api/docs/:docid (Editor Endpoint)

- If `editable: false`, return 403 NOT_EDITABLE
- Size limit: 10MB, UTF-8 only
- Use same path traversal algorithm

**Errors:** NOT_FOUND, FILE_NOT_FOUND, NOT_EDITABLE, PATH_TRAVERSAL, FILE_TOO_LARGE, ENCODING_ERROR

Add to existing response:
- `editable: boolean`

**Security note:** `path` exposed for UX convenience. Server is loopback-only. Add CSRF/origin protection. Add schema + test coverage for `path` field.

ALL errors (413, 422, etc.) return JSON: `{ error: { code, message } }`

Fix stale rendering AND handle rapid edits (latest-wins):

```typescript
useEffect(() => {
  let cancelled = false;
  const requestId = ++requestIdRef.current;
  
  async function highlight() {
    const [light, dark] = await Promise.all([...]);
    // Only apply if this is still the latest request AND not cancelled
    if (!cancelled && requestId === requestIdRef.current) {
```

title: Mirror hash join duplication
description:
## Problem

Multiple active docs can share `mirror_hash` (content-addressed storage). FTS query in `adapter.ts:639-657` joins on `mirror_hash`, causing duplicate results when same chunk matches multiple docs.

## Semantics Decision

**Result unit**: URI-centric (each unique uri+chunk appears once). If same content exists in two files, both appear in results with their own URI. We only eliminate *true duplicates* (same URI row repeated due to join fan-out).

Note: `docid` is derived from `source_hash` (schema.sql:75), so two identical files share the same docid. We partition by `uri` to preserve distinct file results.

## Approach

Use **window function** to pick deterministic document row per URI+chunk:
```sql
SELECT * FROM (
  SELECT 
    d.docid, d.uri, d.title, d.collection, d.rel_path,
    c.mirror_hash, c.seq, c.chunk_text,
    bm25(content_fts) AS score,
    snippet(...) AS snippet,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY d.uri, c.seq ORDER BY d.id) AS rn
  FROM content_fts
  JOIN content_chunks c ON c.rowid = content_fts.rowid
  JOIN documents d ON d.mirror_hash = c.mirror_hash AND d.active = 1
  WHERE content_fts MATCH ?
) WHERE rn = 1
ORDER BY score
```

This:
- Picks first doc row (by d.id) when same URI has multiple active versions
- Preserves all different URIs even if they share content
- Keeps score/snippet row-consistent with selected doc
- Matches `--full` mode's `bestByDocid` semantics (formalized in SQL)

## Key Context

- Schema: `mirror_hash TEXT` is NOT unique (`spec/db/schema.sql:80`)
- Schema: `docid` derived from `source_hash` - identical files share docid
- Partition by `uri` not `docid` to preserve distinct file results
- Requires SQLite ‚â•3.25.0 (window functions) - Bun ships modern SQLite

## Files to Modify

1. `src/store/sqlite/adapter.ts:639-658` - Add ROW_NUMBER window + WHERE rn = 1

## Acceptance Checks

- [ ] Same URI with duplicate rows returns single result
- [ ] Different URIs sharing mirror_hash/docid both appear
- [ ] Score and snippet correspond to selected document row
- [ ] Tests pass with new dedup behavior

title: Reranking takes 6-8s due to full document inference
description:
Reranking performance optimization

## Problem
Full-doc reranking takes 6-8s per query (128K chars √ó 20 docs = 2.56MB through reranker)

## Root Cause Analysis
- 128K chars per doc ‚Üí 8.5s per doc (tested)
- 4K chars per doc ‚Üí 0.3s per doc (25x faster)
- Competitor uses chunk-level rerank (4K max) ‚Üí 4.26s total vs our 17.9s
- Model context is 32K tokens, so 128K chars is wasteful (truncated anyway)

## Solution: Chunk-level reranking (like competitor)
Instead of fetching full documents, use best-scoring chunk per doc:
1. Group FusionCandidates by mirrorHash
2. Pick chunk with highest fusionScore per doc
3. Fetch chunk text via getChunks(hash)[seq]
4. Truncate to 4K chars (MAX_CHUNK_CHARS)
5. Rerank chunks instead of full docs

## Implementation
1. Modify src/pipeline/rerank.ts:
   - Remove MAX_DOC_CHARS = 128_000
   - Add MAX_CHUNK_CHARS = 4_000
   - Change getContent() ‚Üí getChunks() for best chunk
   - Group candidates by doc, pick highest fusionScore

2. Add CLI flags (--fast, --thorough):
   - --fast: skip expansion + skip rerank (~0.7s)
   - default: skip expansion + chunk rerank (~2-3s)
   - --thorough: full expansion + chunk rerank (~5-8s)

3. Update docs:

   - MCP.md: tool parameters
   - Skill instructions: when to use each mode
   - HOW-SEARCH-WORKS.md: updated pipeline

## Agent Instructions (MCP/Skill)
Use default mode first. If no relevant results:
1. Rephrase query (free, like manual expansion)
2. If still no results, retry with --thorough (enables LLM expansion)

|------|------|----------|

description:
## Summary

Add write operations to MCP server to achieve feature parity with WebUI. Enables AI assistants to manage GNO collections, capture notes, and trigger reindexing.

## Design Philosophy

MCP remains **retrieval-focused** - the client LLM (Claude, GPT-4) handles synthesis. We're adding **write operations** for collection management, not duplicating `gno_ask`.

**Note**: MCP may load retrieval-related models (embeddings/rerank/expansion) for hybrid search tools, but does NOT perform answer synthesis.

## Security Model

### Write Tool Gating (Required)

Write tools are **disabled by default** and require explicit opt-in:

```bash
# Enable via CLI flag
gno mcp --enable-write

# Or via environment variable
GNO_MCP_ENABLE_WRITE=1 gno mcp
```

**Rationale**: MCP clients can be configured for auto-approve ("always allow" / agent mode), and prompt injection can coerce users into approving destructive actions. Server-side gating provides defense-in-depth.

When write tools are disabled:
- Tools not registered with MCP server
- Clients see only read-only tools
- No filesystem/config mutation possible

### Collection Root Validation

`gno_add_collection` validates paths to prevent overly broad roots:

**Rejected paths**:
- `/` (root filesystem)
- `~` or `$HOME` alone (entire home dir)
- System directories: `/etc`, `/usr`, `/bin`, `/var`, `/System`, `/Library`
- Hidden config dirs: `~/.config`, `~/.local`, `~/.ssh`, `~/.gnupg`

**Allowed**: Normal user directories like `~/Documents`, `~/notes`, `~/Projects/foo`

This prevents prompt injection from creating "write anywhere" collections while allowing legitimate use.

## Current MCP Tools ‚úÖ

| Tool | Type | Status |
|------|------|--------|
| gno_search | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |
| gno_vsearch | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |
| gno_query | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |
| gno_get | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |
| gno_multi_get | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |
| gno_status | Read | ‚úÖ Implemented |

## New Tools

### Write Operations (require `--enable-write`)

| Tool | Description | Complexity |
|------|-------------|------------|
| gno_capture | Create new document | Medium |
| gno_add_collection | Add folder to index | Medium |
| gno_sync | Reindex collection(s) | Medium |
| gno_remove_collection | Remove collection from config | Easy |

### Job Management

| Tool | Description | Complexity |
|------|-------------|------------|
| gno_job_status | Check async job status | Easy |
| gno_list_jobs | List active/recent jobs | Easy |

## Critical Implementation Constraints

### 1. Mutex & Shutdown Safety

Background jobs MUST integrate with MCP server's single-mutex model:
- All DB access under `ctx.toolMutex` (or dedicated job connection)
- Track active job promises; shutdown MUST await/cancel before DB close
- Jobs acquire mutex around DB operations OR use separate connection

```typescript
// Job must be tracked for shutdown
const jobPromise = runJob(async () => { ... });
ctx.activeJobs.add(jobPromise);
jobPromise.finally(() => ctx.activeJobs.delete(jobPromise));

// Shutdown waits for jobs
async shutdown() {
  await ctx.toolMutex.acquire();
  await Promise.all([...ctx.activeJobs]);
  ctx.store.close();
}
```

### 2. Cross-Process Write Safety (Enforced in Code)

Multiple MCP clients can spawn multiple `gno mcp` processes. Write operations MUST acquire advisory lock:

```typescript
// In core/file-lock.ts - ENFORCED, not just documented
const lockPath = path.join(ctx.indexDir, '.mcp-write.lock');

async function withWriteLock<T>(fn: () => Promise<T>): Promise<T> {
  const fd = await acquireLock(lockPath, { timeout: 5000 });
  if (\!fd) {
    throw new McpError('LOCKED', 'Another MCP process holds the write lock');
  }
  try {
    return await fn();
  } finally {
    await releaseLock(fd);
  }
}

// All write tools wrap their mutations:
return withWriteLock(async () => {
  // config mutation, file write, etc.
});
```

### 3. Config Mutation Flow

Write tools that modify config MUST:
1. Acquire write lock (see above)
2. Load YAML fresh (not stale `ctx.config`)
3. Mutate
4. Save YAML atomically (temp + rename)
5. Sync DB tables (`store.syncCollections`, `store.syncContexts`)
6. Update in-memory `ctx.config` and `ctx.collections`

**Action**: Extract shared config mutation utility from `src/serve/config-sync.ts` into `src/core/config-mutation.ts` usable by both serve and MCP.

### 4. Stdout Purity

All subprocesses (git pull, updateCmd) MUST use `.quiet()` or redirect output. A single stray stdout byte corrupts JSON-RPC framing.

### 5. Job Error Containment

Jobs launched fire-and-forget MUST wrap with `.catch().finally()` to prevent unhandled rejections from crashing the MCP server.

### 6. Job Session Lifetime

Jobs are **per-session** (in-memory only):
- Job IDs valid only within the same running MCP server process
- Polling after server restart returns `NOT_FOUND`
- Different MCP processes cannot query each other's jobs

Document this clearly in MCP.md. Future enhancement could persist to SQLite.

```json
    "title": { "type": "string", "description": "Document title (used for filename if path not provided)" },
```

title: Migrate from bun:sqlite to better-sqlite3 for cross-platform sqlite-vec support
description:
## Problem

bun:sqlite bundled SQLite doesn't support dynamic extension loading, which breaks sqlite-vec (vector search).

Current workaround uses Database.setCustomSQLite() to load Homebrew SQLite on macOS, but this:
- Requires users to install Homebrew + sqlite3 on macOS
- Doesn't work on Windows
- Requires system packages on Linux
- Not portable or user-friendly

## Solution

Migrate from bun:sqlite to better-sqlite3:
- Native extension support on all platforms
- Prebuilt binaries for Windows/Linux/macOS (via prebuild)
- Standard approach used by sqlite-vec examples

## Implementation

1. Add better-sqlite3 dependency
2. Create adapter abstraction if needed for type compatibility
3. Update src/store/sqlite/adapter.ts to use better-sqlite3
4. Update src/store/vector/sqlite-vec.ts to use better-sqlite3 API
5. Remove src/store/sqlite/setup.ts workaround
6. Test on macOS, Linux, Windows
7. Update README with any remaining requirements

## Acceptance criteria

- Vector search works on macOS without Homebrew SQLite
- Vector search works on Linux without extra packages
- Vector search works on Windows
- All existing tests pass
- No user-facing installation steps beyond bun install

| BM25 search, get, ls | Works everywhere |
| vsearch/hybrid vectors | sqlite-vec extension |
| rerank/ask --answer | Models cached |

Canonical verification: `gno doctor`

## Approach

### Phase 1: Foundation (parallelizable)
1. **D3: INSTALLATION.md** - Install paths, prereqs, capabilities matrix, `gno doctor` verification

- Self-contained sections for AI retrieval

title: Homebrew Tap: brew install gno for macOS/Linux
description:
Enable one-command installation via Homebrew for non-developer users.

## Goal
`brew tap gmickel/gno && brew install gno` provides **FULL gno functionality** on macOS and Linux.

## Critical Design Decision: Hermetic Installation

**Problem**: Standard npm-wrapper approach (`bun install` at install time) violates Homebrew's hermetic model.

**Solution: Single-archive release artifact** with vendored node_modules including pre-built native binaries.

### Why This Works for node-llama-cpp

node-llama-cpp uses **optional dependencies** with pre-built platform-specific packages:
- `@node-llama-cpp/mac-arm64-metal` - macOS ARM with Metal
- `@node-llama-cpp/mac-x64` - macOS Intel
- `@node-llama-cpp/linux-x64` - Linux x64
- `@node-llama-cpp/linux-arm64` - Linux ARM64

These packages contain **pre-built .dylib/.so files** - no compilation needed!

When CI runs `bun install` on each platform:
1. Correct platform-specific package downloads
2. Pre-built binaries land in `node_modules/@node-llama-cpp/*/bins/`
3. We tar everything
4. Homebrew users get full functionality, zero builds

**No build toolchain required** - we ship pre-built binaries.

## Approach

1. **Build step in CI**: Create platform-specific tarballs
   - `gno-darwin-arm64.tar.gz` (includes @node-llama-cpp/mac-arm64-metal)
   - `gno-darwin-x64.tar.gz` (includes @node-llama-cpp/mac-x64)
   - `gno-linux-x64.tar.gz` (includes @node-llama-cpp/linux-x64)
   - `gno-linux-arm64.tar.gz` (includes @node-llama-cpp/linux-arm64)

2. **Formula downloads correct tarball** per arch

3. **No bun install at brew time** - everything vendored

4. **Test block** uses `GNO_SKIP_MODEL_DOWNLOAD=1` for fast offline tests

## Complete API Patterns from Web UI Review (gno-7tp)

This is the comprehensive reference. Apply these patterns to avoid re-review.

---

### API Endpoint Contracts

#### GET /api/doc (Extended)
Response now includes:
```json
{
  ...existing fields...,
  "editable": true,           // boolean - based on sourceExt allowlist
  "indexStale": false,        // boolean | null - mtime comparison
  "path": "/abs/path/file.md" // string - absolute filesystem path
}
```

#### GET /api/docs/:docid (Editor Endpoint)
- **Editor-only** - returns fresh disk content
- If `editable: false`, return **403 NOT_EDITABLE** (don't read binary)
- Size limit: 10MB (stat.size bytes)
- UTF-8 only; non-UTF-8 returns 422

Response:
```json
{
  "docid": "string",
  "uri": "string",
  "title": "string",
  "collection": "string",
  "relPath": "string",
  "path": "string",
  "content": "string",
  "mtime": "ISO date",
  "editable": true,
  "indexStale": false
}
```

#### PUT /api/docs/:docid (Update)
Request: `{ "content": "string" }`
- Empty string is VALID
- Atomic write (POSIX: temp+rename; Windows: backup-rename)

Response: `{ "success": true, "docid": "...", "path": "...", "needsReindex": true }`

#### POST /api/docs/:docid/reindex
- Uses syncSingleDoc (fast, not collection scan)
- Returns: `{ "jobId": "..." }`
- Job result: normal SyncResult shape

#### POST /api/docs (Capture)
Request:
```json
{
  "collection": "string",  // required
  "relPath": "string",     // required - use path generation below
  "content": "string"      // includes frontmatter if tags
}
```

**Path generation**: `inbox/YYYYMMDD-HHmmss-<slug>.md`
- Timestamp: YYYYMMDD-HHmmss (NO COLONS - filesystem-safe for Windows)
- Slug: lowercase, hyphens, no special chars
- Collision: append -1, -2, etc.

**Frontmatter merge** (if content has existing frontmatter):
- Parse existing YAML frontmatter
- Merge tags (dedupe, alphabetical sort)
- Preserve other fields
- Reconstruct frontmatter block

---

### Error Handling

**ALL errors return JSON envelope** (including 413, 422):
```json
{ "error": { "code": "ERROR_CODE", "message": "Human message" } }
```

**Error codes**:
| Code | Status | Description |
|------|--------|-------------|
| NOT_FOUND | 404 | Document not in index |
| FILE_NOT_FOUND | 404 | Doc in index but file missing on disk |
| NOT_EDITABLE | 403 | sourceExt not in allowlist |
| PATH_TRAVERSAL | 403 | Resolved path outside collection (symlink attack) |
| VALIDATION | 400 | Invalid request body |
| CONFLICT | 409 | Job already running |
| FILE_TOO_LARGE | 413 | File > 10MB |
| ENCODING_ERROR | 422 | Not valid UTF-8 |
| RUNTIME | 500 | Server error |

---

### Editability

**Allowlist approach** (NOT denylist):
- Editable: md, markdown, txt, text, json, yaml, yml, toml, xml, css
- Everything else NOT editable
- **Case-insensitive** comparison
- Missing/empty sourceExt = NOT editable

---

### Stale Detection

**indexStale field**: `boolean | null`
- `true` = file mtime > indexed sourceMtime (stale)
- `false` = file mtime <= indexed sourceMtime (current)
- `null` = cannot determine (file missing, symlink escapes collection)

**Comparison rules**:
- Compare epoch milliseconds
- Strict greater-than only
- Missing sourceMtime = true
- mtime is heuristic, not cryptographic

**UI for null**: "Cannot determine staleness" - disable reindex button

---

### Document Identity

- **docid**: URL-safe hex string, stable for indexed entry lifetime
- If file renamed and reindexed, old docid becomes 404
- **ALWAYS use encodeURIComponent()** for path construction
- **404 UX**: "Document no longer exists" with Back/Search/Browse buttons

---

### Path Traversal Protection (Symlink-Safe)

Use realpath() on both root and target:
```typescript
const rootReal = await realpath(collection.path);
const targetReal = await realpath(targetPath);
if (!targetReal.startsWith(rootReal + path.sep)) {
  return errorResponse('PATH_TRAVERSAL', 403);
}
```

**For missing files** (PUT/GET):
1. Try realpath(targetPath)
2. If fails, try realpath(dirname(targetPath))
3. If parent outside root: PATH_TRAVERSAL
4. If parent inside root: FILE_NOT_FOUND

---

### Atomic Write (Windows)

**Backup-rename pattern** (safer than unlink-first):
1. Write to `.gno-tmp-{random}`
2. Rename dest ‚Üí dest.gno-bak
3. Rename temp ‚Üí dest
4. Delete .gno-bak (best-effort)

**Documented limitation**: Not fully atomic on Windows, but no data loss window

**Cleanup**: On startup, remove stale `.gno-tmp-*` and `.gno-bak`

**Exclusion**: These patterns auto-excluded from indexing

---

### Multi-Client Limitation

- Concurrent editing in multiple tabs/clients NOT supported
- Last save wins (no server-side revision checking)
- Document this limitation in UX

---

### Job Model

- Single job at a time; new requests return 409 CONFLICT
- Poll GET /api/jobs/:jobId for status
- Per-doc reindex returns normal SyncResult shape
- Disable action buttons while job running

---

### Security Notes

- `path` field: exposed for UX convenience, server is loopback-only
- All mutations: CSRF/origin check via isRequestAllowed()
- Path traversal: check on BOTH read and write
- External links: target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"

---

### Field Semantics

- `needsReindex`: returned by PUT (immediate context - "you just made it stale")
- `indexStale`: computed at read time via mtime comparison

title: Auto-download models on first use
description:
## Implementation Plan

### Approach
Modify `LlmAdapter.create*Port()` to auto-download missing models via `ensureModel()` helper. Add `--offline` flag. Use cross-process lockfile for concurrency.

### Key Design Decisions
- **No confirmation prompt**: Auto-download with progress message
- **Cross-process locking**: Lockfile keyed by canonical realpath
- **Manifest atomic writes**: Write .tmp, fsync file, rename, fsync dir
- **Lock ordering**: Always manifest lock first, then model lock
- **Stale lock recovery**: Atomic break-and-reacquire pattern
- **DownloadPolicy**: `{ allowDownload, offline }` from `resolveDownloadPolicy(env, flags)`

### Lock Key Normalization
- Canonical key = `realpath(cacheDir) + '/' + resolvedRelativePath`
- For quant shorthand: two-phase lock (Phase A by quant, Phase B by resolved path)

### Stale Lock Recovery
1. Try create lockfile O_EXCL ‚Üí success: own lock
2. If exists + stale: rename to .stale, create fresh O_EXCL
3. If not stale: wait/retry with backoff
- TTL configurable (default 1hr)

### Policy Resolution
Precedence (first wins):
1. `--offline` flag ‚Üí offline=true, allowDownload=false
2. `HF_HUB_OFFLINE=1` ‚Üí offline=true, allowDownload=false
3. `GNO_NO_AUTO_DOWNLOAD=1` ‚Üí offline=false, allowDownload=false
4. Default ‚Üí offline=false, allowDownload=true

### Command Behavior (BEHAVIOR CHANGE)
CLI defaults to BM25-only. Hybrid/expand requires flags.
- `gno index/embed`: Auto-download embed (required)
- `gno query`: Embed only. Rerank if --rerank. Gen if --expand
- `gno ask`: Embed only. Gen if --answer

### New Error Codes
- `CACHE_IO_FAILED`, `LOCK_FAILED`

### Progress UX
- Throttle: emit max once per 100ms + always on completion/error
- Non-TTY: periodic lines
- Suppress when --json

### References
- ModelCache: `src/llm/cache.ts`
- LlmAdapter: `src/llm/nodeLlamaCpp/adapter.ts`
- MCP stdout guard: `src/mcp/server.ts`

title: Strong signal detection (skip expansion)
description:
Skip expensive LLM query expansion when BM25 returns strong, unambiguous results.

## Why
- Query expansion costs LLM inference time
- When top BM25 result is clearly correct, expansion adds latency without benefit
- Competitor implements this optimization

## Implementation (src/pipeline/expansion.ts or query.ts)

### Detection Logic
```typescript
const topScore = bm25Results[0]?.score ?? 0;
const secondScore = bm25Results[1]?.score ?? 0;
const hasStrongSignal = bm25Results.length > 0 
  && topScore >= 0.85 
  && (topScore - secondScore) >= 0.15;

if (hasStrongSignal) {
  // Skip LLM expansion, use original query only
  console.log(\`Strong BM25 signal (\${topScore.toFixed(2)}) - skipping expansion\`);
  return { lexicalQueries: [], vectorQueries: [], hyde: null };
}
```

### Thresholds (from competitor)
- Top score >= 0.85 (very confident match)
- Gap between #1 and #2 >= 0.15 (clear winner)

## Benefits
- Faster response for obvious queries
- Lower LLM API/compute costs
- No quality degradation (expansion not needed)

## Considerations
- Add --force-expand flag to override
- Log when skipping for debugging
- May need to tune thresholds for our score normalization

See notes/epic-search-quality-improvements.md for full context.

   - Install from https://bun.sh

### Indexing Issues
4. **"Files not being indexed"**
   - Check glob pattern, exclude list
   - Run `gno ls <collection>` to verify

5. **"Conversion failed for PDF/DOCX"**
   - Check file isn't corrupted
   - markitdown-ts limitations

6. **"Index very slow"**
   - Large files being chunked
   - Set maxBytes limit

### Search Issues
7. **"Vector search unavailable"**
   - sqlite-vec not loaded (graceful degradation)
   - Run `gno doctor` to check

8. **"No results found"**
   - Check collection indexed: `gno status`
   - Lower --min-score threshold

   - Run `gno embed` first

10. **"Model download stuck"**
    - Check network, HuggingFace status
    - Clear cache: ~/.cache/gno/models

11. **"Out of memory"**
    - Use smaller preset (slim)
    - Reduce batch size

### MCP Issues
12. **"MCP server not responding"**
    - Check config JSON syntax
    - Restart Claude Desktop/Code

# Plan: Deep Codebase Review for Documentation

## Overview
Thorough code review before writing world-class docs. Output: `docs/NOTES.md` with architecture, design decisions, score normalization, models, and data flow diagrams.

**Source-of-Truth Rule**: Specs (`spec/cli.md`, `spec/mcp.md`, `spec/output-schemas/*.json`) are authoritative contracts. `docs/NOTES.md` is implementation notes: how it's built, design rationale, code pointers, non-contractual details. Link to specs, don't duplicate.

## Approach

### Phase 1: Spec & Schema Review
Review all specifications - these are THE source of truth:
- `spec/cli.md` (25+ commands, 5 output formats, 3 exit codes, stdout/stderr rules)
- `spec/mcp.md` (6 tools, 1 resource type)
- `spec/output-schemas/*.json` (5 schemas) + `test/spec/schemas/*` contract tests
- `spec/db/schema.sql` (9 tables)

Document interface invariants:
- stdout vs stderr policies
- exit code mapping (0=success, 1=error, 2=partial)
- JSON schema validation + where contract tests live

### Phase 2: Pipeline Deep Dive
Trace query ‚Üí results flow through hybrid search:
- `src/pipeline/hybrid.ts:184-524` - Main orchestrator
- `src/pipeline/search.ts` - BM25 + min-max normalization
- `src/pipeline/vsearch.ts` - Vector + distance‚Üísimilarity
- `src/pipeline/fusion.ts` - RRF (k=60, weights, topRankBonus)
- `src/pipeline/rerank.ts` - Position-aware blending tiers
- `src/pipeline/expansion.ts` - Query expansion w/ language prompts
- `src/pipeline/query-language.ts` - Language detection (franc)

**Score Semantics** (critical section):
- BM25 normalization is per-query (not comparable across queries)
- Hybrid blending uses normalized fusion scores, clamped per-query
- `--min-score` applies post-normalization
- Tie-breaking: mirrorHash:seq determinism
- Explicit formulas with file/line pointers

### Phase 3: Storage Layer
Document SQLite adapter + sqlite-vec:
- `src/store/sqlite/adapter.ts` - Core StorePort implementation
- `src/store/vector/sqlite-vec.ts` - Per-model vec tables
- Graceful degradation when sqlite-vec unavailable

**Migrations & FTS mechanics**:
- Migration runner behavior, `schema_meta` fields (version, fts_tokenizer)
- FTS virtual table creation/rebuild triggers
- `escapeFts5Query()` behavior (what queries are supported)
- Tokenizer config immutability

### Phase 4: Ingestion & Models
Document chunking, conversion, and model configuration:
- `src/ingestion/chunker.ts:74-86` - 800 tokens, 15% overlap
- `src/ingestion/language.ts` - CJK/European detection

**Converter subsystem** (critical):
- MIME detection ‚Üí converter registry ‚Üí canonical markdown
- Canonical markdown rules (what changes `mirror_hash`)
- converterId/converterVersion tracking
- Failure modes: `ingest_errors`, `last_error_*` fields
- Core invariant: "search operates on mirror; identity refers to source"

**Model presets**:
- `src/config/types.ts:170-195` - 3 presets (slim/balanced/quality)
- `src/llm/registry.ts` - Preset resolution
- Disk size only for models (RAM is workload-dependent, add disclaimer)

### Phase 5: Write docs/NOTES.md
Create `docs/NOTES.md` with header: `Reviewed at commit: <hash>`

Contents:
1. Architecture overview (Mermaid for complex flows, ASCII for simple)
2. Data flow: file ‚Üí convert ‚Üí chunk ‚Üí embed ‚Üí index
3. Query flow: query ‚Üí expansion ‚Üí retrieval ‚Üí fusion ‚Üí rerank ‚Üí results
4. **Score Semantics**: normalization table, comparability rules, minScore behavior
5. Model preset table (disk size, with RAM disclaimer)
6. Key design decisions & rationale (link to specs, don't duplicate)
7. Graceful degradation paths (explicit branches)
8. Interface invariants (stdout/stderr, exit codes, schema refs)

## Key References
- `spec/cli.md:L1-928` - CLI contract (authoritative)
- `spec/mcp.md:L1-538` - MCP contract (authoritative)
- `spec/output-schemas/*.json` - Output schemas (authoritative)
- `src/pipeline/types.ts:152-233` - RRF config, blending tiers
- `src/ingestion/types.ts:66-78` - ChunkParams
- `test/spec/schemas/*` - Contract tests

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All spec files reviewed and cross-referenced (link, don't duplicate)
- [ ] Score semantics section with comparability rules and formulas
- [ ] Pipeline diagram (Mermaid for complex, ASCII for overview)
- [ ] Model presets table (disk size; RAM disclaimer)
- [ ] Graceful degradation paths as explicit branches
- [ ] Converter/canonicalization subsystem documented
- [ ] Migrations/FTS mechanics covered
- [ ] NOTES.md includes "Reviewed at commit: <hash>" header
- [ ] NOTES.md contains required section headings (lintable)

## Maintenance Policy
Update NOTES.md when:
- Pipeline scoring changes (src/pipeline/*)
- Schema changes (spec/db/schema.sql, migrations)
- Model presets change (src/config/types.ts)
- Spec contracts change (spec/*.md)

PRs touching these paths should trigger doc review.

## Risks
- Score thresholds may need code archaeology to explain "why"
- Some edge cases need runtime verification
- RAM requirements are workload-dependent (use disk size + disclaimer)
